roleset.name: combine, mix, cause to combine, combine or mix together

example.name: combine-v: separate ingredients, and agent
example.text: The plan still calls for LIN to combine its cellular telephone properties with Bell South 's and to spin off its broadcasting operations .

example.name: combine-v: separate ingredients, passivized
example.text: GMAC profits are combined with earnings from the rest of GM 's operations and attributed to the company 's traditional common stock .

propbank.arg: with earnings from the rest of GM 's operations

example.name: combine-v: ergative, one ingredient
example.text: Mr. Bryant and other analysts hope all those moves will combine to help Tandy 's results improve in the important Christmas quarter .

propbank.arg: to help Tandy 's results improve in the important Christmas quarter

example.name: combine-v: ergative, two ingredients
example.text: Sterling 's firm tone , combined with a steady opening on Wall Street , also tempted some investors to come back to the market , dealers said .

propbank.arg: with a steady opening on Wall Street

example.name: combine-v: with end product
example.text: Further , he said , an internal reorganization to combine several divisions into the Information Technology Group is expected to affect fourth - quarter results by an undisclosed amount .

example.name: conglomeration-n
example.text: a conglomeration of regional lymph node metasteses

example.name: combination-n: What to do if both ingredients are lumped together
example.text: The combination of traditional Taiwanese and contemporary factors

propbank.arg: of traditional Taiwanese and contemporary factors

example.name: combination-n: Two ingredients treed in seperate PPs
example.text: The combination of solid loan growth with tight expense control

example.name: combination-n: Three ingredients; one PP
example.text: some combination of drug , alcohol , and mental problems .

propbank.arg: of drug , alcohol , and mental problems

example.name: combination-n: Arg 0
example.text: the network 's inabliity to match a Time - Warner combination

roleset.note: COMBINE-V NOTES: Probably this verb should not show both ergative and passiveformations; I think this is an(other) inconsistency in treebank. (from combine.01-v)
CONGLOMERATION-N NOTES: Based on the stratified corpus. Comparison to combine.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from conglomeration.01-n)
COMBINATION-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'combine'. VN class mix-22.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from combination.01-n)
If both ingredients are lumped together, use arg 1. (from combination.01-n)
